image.altText: Triple zero number about to be called on a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Police say they also received a call from a university student who wanted their professor's contact details to request a deadline extension and a man who wanted a stray cat on his street to be arrested.Â

image.altText: Two men and a police officer under a Police Rescue Marquee

props.synopsis: The 23-year-old university student from Melbourne has been found in "good health" after he went missing in dense bushland in the NSW Snowy Mountains on Boxing Day.

title.children: Missing hiker 'survived on two muesli bars' during 13 days in the bush

image.altText: Dozens of cars and three helicopters on a road

props.synopsis: Professional cyclist Jay Vine aims to claim his second Tour Down Under title after recovering from a life-threatening crash.

title.children: Jay Vine sets sights on second title after life-threatening crash

image.altText: A close-up shot of a doctor noting down symptoms of a patient on a form with a stethoscope hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor has been accused of discrimination for cancelling a teenage transgender patient's routine appointment for adolescent vaccinations.

title.children: Human rights complaint made after transgender teen's GP visit cancelled

image.altText: Woman lying in curled up position on couch.

props.synopsis: The researchers hope their project can be used to build a profile of endometriosis sufferers.Â

title.children: No 'cure' but research could improve life for endometriosis patients

image.altText: A woman in front of a horse yard fence pats a horse in the yard.

title.children: During Canberra's firestorm, Jane protected horses. She wishes she hadn't

title.children: Travellers will soon have to pay to enter the UK. What you need to know

image.altText: White foam is sprayed from a yellow fire truck towards a plane that is parked on the tarmac.

title.children: Authorities reveal cause of Etihad Airways aborted take-off in Melbourne

image.altText: A man with long hair in a polo shirt stands in front of a pyramid shaped building and flag poles.

props.synopsis: Former Barkly mayor Jeff McLaughlin has avoided a conviction for drug-driving and cannabis possession after prosecutors withdrew more serious charges against him.

title.children: Jeff McLaughlin avoids conviction, cleared of serious drug charges

image.altText: A burning remains of a plane.

props.synopsis: Park Sang-woo said "I feel heavy responsibility for this disaster," and that he will try to find the right time to resign from his post.

title.children: South Korean minister plans to resign over country's worst plane crash

image.altText: A drone looking down shows a missile about to blast closely past it.

props.synopsis:
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has overseen a successful test of a new intermediate-range hypersonic ballistic missile, state media KCNA said.
It was North Korea's first missile launch since November 5, and coincided with a visit to South Korea by US Secretary of State, Antony Blinken.

title.children: North Korea releases video of missile launch

image.altText: For sale sign outside an apartment building along a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: China's property crash is bad news for Australia's economy, and there's even a risk it could precipitate our own housing crisis.

title.children: China's property crash a warning for Australia's housing market

image.altText: Kamala Harris stands in the rostrum in the House of Representatives, a US flag behind her.

props.synopsis: The January 6 certification ceremony was free of the chaos and violence of four years ago, but undoubtedly still uncomfortable for its presiding officer, Kamala Harris.Â

title.children: Harris presides over certification of Donald Trump's win

image.altText: A man in a black pinstripe suit walks sullenly behind a guard

props.synopsis: France's former president Nicolas Sarkozy is going on trial over his alleged links to Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi, but it will not be his first time in court.Â

title.children: Why France's Sarkozy is going on trial and how he's linked to Gaddafi

image.altText: A shopping centre in Box Hill

props.synopsis: Three elderly victims were allegedly scammed out of more than $200,000 in Box Hill last year, after being told they were being followed by an evil spirit.

title.children: Police hunt for 'blessing' scammers targeting elderly in Melbourne's east

image.altText: Demi Moore smiling holding a Golden Globe.

The Golden Globes is one of Hollywood's biggest parties â and like any good party, we've woken up with a hangover and plenty of time to reflect on the evening, including Demi Moore's powerful speech in her shock win for The Substance.Â

title.children: What's a 'popcorn actress'? Here's why Demi Moore's speech has people paying attention

title.children: Search for missing fisherman suspended after four days

title.children: Keir Starmer slams 'lies' after online attacks from Elon Musk

image.altText: A middle-aged man kneels in a field holding three freshly-picked zucchinis.

props.synopsis: Ross Marsolino has spent more than 40 years feeding Australian families. But the price discrepancies he has faced recently have driven him to leave the industry completely.

title.children: Fed-up farmer quits industry over supermarket price discrepancy

image.altText: close up Blake D'Ombrain

props.synopsis: Blake D'Ombrain, 19, broke his neck after jumping headfirst into a sandbank off a popular jetty on New Year's Eve.

title.children: Man on life support after NYE jetty jump faces long hospital recovery

image.altText: Three men laying turf at a race track.

props.synopsis: Police are testing discarded weed spray nozzles found at the Gold Coast Turf Club as the mystery deepens into how the track was poisoned ahead of the city's Magic Millions race day.

title.children: Suspicious items found near damaged Gold Coast Magic Millions racetrack

image.altText: Man in bright ski gear skis down christmas decorated street

props.synopsis: Governors across the US declare states of emergency after heavy snowfall closed federal offices and public schools, left homes and businesses without power, disrupted travel and left motorists stranded.Â

title.children: US governors declare state of emergency amid major winter storm

image.altText: A man plays a shot during a tennis match

props.synopsis: Veteran Bernard Tomic and 16-year old Cruz Hewitt have both made quick exits from the Australian Open qualifiers as the duo both fell in straight sets in the first round.Â

title.children: Bernard Tomic and Cruz Hewitt out of Australian Open qualifiers

image.altText: A burnt car on a dirt road.

props.synopsis: Police say they're still investigating the death of a man whose body was found in a burnt-out car along a forest track, despite already charging two women with murder.

title.children: Police still chasing leads on burnt-out car death, as two women charged with murder

image.altText: person who is blurred walks in front of the new york stock exchange, sign says wall street

props.synopsis: Analysts point to optimism about the US economy, but much will ride on decisions made by US president-elect Donald Trump, and the direction of interest rates both here in Australia and overseas.

title.children: Analysts issue warning as more Australians dive into Wall Street

image.altText: Black and white image of cars hanging over Hobart's Tasman Bridge in 1975 after a section was knocked down by a ship

props.synopsis: An exhibition commemorating the collapse of the Tasman Bridge 50 years ago features two cars captured in a now-iconic photo of the incident. The museum now admits one of the Holdens on display "is not the car that was on bridge".

title.children: Museum admits Holden in Tasman Bridge collapse exhibit not original

image.altText: An endangered Little Tern sitting next to its chick.

props.synopsis: More than 30,000 cubic metres of dredged sand deposited on a tiny island south of Newcastle in NSW has delighted an endangered little tern population. More than 50 have begun to lay and hatch their eggs in sand on the island.

title.children: Dredging creates 'perfect' island hatchery for endangered birds

image.altText: A young man in handcuffs at the airport flanked by AFP officers in plain black clothes.

props.synopsis: A man has been extradited from Queensland to face charges in Sydney after his alleged involvement in an attempted "gang-related" home invasion and subsequent car chase with police.

title.children: Man extradited from Queensland after alleged home invasion in Sydney

title.children: NT police station cells at capacity with prisoners, as arrests rise

image.altText: Danny Gibson looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Child grooming and indecent assault are among a raft of allegations made against Launceston councillor Danny Gibson from information received by Tasmania's Justice Department.

title.children: Grooming allegations against former mayor aired in risk assessment

image.altText: The AI Lucas, a tall, grey-haired blue-eyed man standing inside a kitchen.

props.synopsis: As the popularity of AI-generated companions grows, there are calls for greater regulation of a rapidly expanding world that some fear is disconnecting users from real-life human relationships.
